author: T Madhavan
text:
Water Resources Department or Chennai Metrowater yet to initiate permanent measures

The heavy downpour in December last not only submerged the entire city, but also rendered it without power, telephone network and road connectivity. Following the heavy rain, the issue of poor maintenance of Chembarambakkam Reservoir, one of the main sources for drinking water for city residents, has been raised by those living around it.

The residents said that only temporary steps were taken to protect it, but the two government agencies involved — Water Resources Department and Chennai Metrowater — were yet to initiate permanent measures. S. Raja of Periyar Nagar, Nandambakkam, said the sidewalls of the shutters in the reservoir started developing cracks and wall packing (that holds the cement structure with bund) gave way after the rains.

“Though workers packed the broken wall with sand bags, further course of repair is yet to begin,” he added.

M. Suresh of Surya Nagar said the walls developed cracks at many levels and it created a sense of fear among residents, who were closely monitoring the water levels after every spell of rain during the monsoon last year. He said the walls were built by WRD several years ago were strong enough all these years.

But, the recent heavy downpour left them with a permanent ‘scar’. “The walls should be repaired as an emergency measure before the announcement of Assembly elections,” he said.
title: Repair sidewalls: residents
